quark_ponders.ponder.minecraft_chain.tex: Chains can now connect blocks together when a piston moves them
As you can see, the chain block itself doesn't have to be moved by the piston, and will attach indirectly to other moved blocks.
Chains will only connect to blocks if they do so visually.
quark_ponders.ponder.quark_chute.text_1:
The Chute is a new automation block.
This is NOT a hopper!
quark_ponders.ponder.quark_chute.text_2: Items can be inserted into it via automation (Hopper, Dropper, etc)
quark_ponders.ponder.quark_chute.text_3: Any items inserted are instantly dropped under it, always precisely in the center.
quark_ponders.ponder.quark_chute.text_4: The Chute can be disabled with a redstone signal..
quark_ponders.ponder.quark_chute.text_5: Placing a block under it disables it too.
quark_ponders.ponder.quark_chute.text_6:
The Chute can drop items through hollow logs.
(Any block with a hole in the middle)
quark_ponders.ponder.minecraft_dispenser: Dispensers are allowed to place blocks in the world.
Any blocks that already had a placement behaviour, like TNT, are ignored.
The blocks are rotated so they're placed forward from the dispenser.
Note that crops such as Wheat Seeds or Potatoes also count.
quark_ponders.ponder.quark_ender_watcher: The Ender Watcher is a new redstone input block.
It emits a redstone signal if a player is looking directly at it.
The signal is higher the closer to the center of the block the player is looking.
quark_ponders.ponder.quark_feeding_troug: The Feeding Trough is a new block that can hold animal food in it.
While holding the correct food, it will attract and breed animals from %s blocks around it.
There's a chance the animal will need more than one bit of food to get in love mode.
If there's more than %s animals in a %d block radius, the animals will eat, but never enter love mode.
quark_ponders.ponder.quark_gravisand.tex:
Gravisand is a new sand variant.
It will not fall unless primed with redstone.
However, if gravisand receives a signal, and can not fall, it'll instead float up.
Gravisand will propagate the signal to any adjacent gravisand blocks, causing them to fall or float as well.
Gravisand always outputs a comparator signal of 15.
quark_ponders.ponder.quark_iron_rod.head: Iron Rod
quark_ponders.ponder.quark_iron_rod.text: Pistons pushing an Iron Rod will have it work as a drill of sorts.
An Iron Rod will break any blocks in front of it.
Iron Rods will only break blocks that pistons can push.
quark_ponders.ponder.quark_metal_buttons: Gold and Iron buttons draw influence from Weighted Pressure Plates.

Gold Buttons emit a very short pulse.
(2 redstone ticks)

Iron Buttons emit a very long pulse.
(5 seconds)
quark_ponders.ponder.quark_obsidian_pres: Pressure Plates made with obsidian will only trigger when Players walk over them.
quark_ponders.ponder.quark_piston_move_t:
Pistons are allowed to move Tile Entities.
(Blocks with extra data attached, like Chests or Furnaces)
Attempting to move a block to an invalid position will cause it to break and drop its contents
For a block that pistons can't move, now that furnaces can't be used, look into Sturdy Stone in the Building category.
Note that some blocks such as Monster Spawners can't be moved this way, so you don't go and break the game!
quark_ponders.ponder.quark_redstone_rand: The Randomizer is a new redstone component.
When given a redstone signal from the back, it'll randomly enable either the left or right output.
quark_ponders.ponder.quark_glass_item_fr: Glass Item Frames work like normal item frames but they hide when you place an item on them.
If you put a banner inside a Glass Item Frame, it'll sit flat with the wall with the pattern that's in it.
Glass Item Frames can attach to the front of a Sign that's placed on the floor.
This will make the item show flush with the sign.
Glass Item Frames can be right clicked through to open chests or other inventories.
When a map is placed in a Glass Item Frame, it will update in real time. Perfect for spies!
quark_ponders.ponder.quark_grate.text_1: The Iron Grate a new block that lets items fall through, but not mobs.
quark_ponders.ponder.quark_grate.text_2: Additionally, farm mobs won't try to walk over them.
quark_ponders.ponder.quark_grate.text_3: Farm mobs on a leash are not affected!
quark_ponders.ponder.quark_grate.text_4: The Iron Grate can be waterlogged, items will float through it.
quark_ponders.ponder.quark_rope.text_1: The Rope can be placed on the bottom face of a block, by players and dispensers.
quark_ponders.ponder.quark_rope.text_2: You can also extend it down by right clicking the rope block with more rope or dispenser.
quark_ponders.ponder.quark_rope.text_3: Right clicking with an empty hand or a non rope item will pull the rope up.
quark_ponders.ponder.quark_rope.text_4: You can't do it with dispensers tho.
quark_ponders.ponder.quark_rope.text_5: As you can see, ropes can pull up and push down (some) blocks at the end of them.
quark_ponders.ponder.quark_toretoise.tex: Oretoises are new neutral mobs that will spawn deep underground and in complete darkness.
quark_ponders.ponder.quark_skull_spike.t: Setting a Skeleton Skull, Zombie Head, or Creeper Head over a fence, will create a skull pike.
Nearby monsters in a %s block range and with line of sight will notice it, and run away in cowardice.
Note that Wither Skulls and Dragon head don't work for this.
Bosses and raiders are slightly more astute, and won't fall for this trickery.
Lastly, mobs focused on the player won't fear the spikes.
quark_ponders.ponder.quark_enhanced_ladd: Right clicking a ladder with another one will place it, allowing you to drop ladders down without risking falling to your death.
As long as the first ladder is supported, the ones below can freestand.
When on a ladder, looking down will make you slide down the ladder very quickly.
quark_ponders.ponder.quark_scaffolding_s: Right clicking on a Scaffold with a block will attempt to place the block at the end of the Scaffold chain.
By default it'll turn direction once, so it can build blocks horizontally if you extend scaffolds that way.
If you wish to use the default behaviour of placing blocks on the scaffold, you can still do it with shift-right click.
quark_ponders.ponder.quark_slimes_to_mag: When a large slime dies on magma blocks, the slimes spawned will be turned into magma cubes.
quark_ponders.ponder.quark_pipe.text_1: Copper Pipes can transport items from point A to point B.
quark_ponders.ponder.quark_pipe.text_2: To get items into a pipe simply use a Hopper, Dropper, or any other insertion means you may have handy.
quark_ponders.ponder.quark_pipe.text_3: At an intersection, Items will move forward if possible.
quark_ponders.ponder.quark_pipe.text_4: If not, items will try to randomly flow left or right if possible.
quark_ponders.ponder.quark_pipe.text_5:
Pipes can be disabled with redstone.
Items will not flow into disabled (powered) pipes.
quark_ponders.ponder.quark_pipe.text_6: When items can't go any other direction, they will try go up.
quark_ponders.ponder.quark_pipe.text_7: By default, all items will try go down whenever possible.
quark_ponders.ponder.quark_pipe.text_8: Items can go in and out of pipes.
quark_ponders.ponder.quark_pipe.text_9:
Comparators can read how many items are in a pipe.
One redstone lever per stack of blocks inside the pipe.
quark_ponders.ponder.quark_pipe.text_10: Finally, if there is more than 15 stacks of items in one pipe (or just 15 different items), this will break and drop the items in the world.
quark_ponders.ponder.quark_magnet.text_1:
Magnets can move metallic blocks.
A metallic block is defined as block made of Iron or Copper Ingots..
quark_ponders.ponder.quark_magnet.text_2: ..or things made of Iron or Copper Ingots
quark_ponders.ponder.quark_magnet.text_5: When multiple Magnets are exerting force upon the same block, the one with the biggest force wins.
quark_ponders.ponder.quark_magnet.text_6: A magnet's force upon a block is the redstone level applied to it, minus the distance.
quark_ponders.ponder.quark_magnet.text_7: When a Hopper is moved, it'll drop one of its items directly in front of it.
quark_ponders.ponder.quark_magnet.text_8: If this item is a seed, it'll plant it either directly in front or one block down.
quark_ponders.ponder.quark_magnet.text_9: When a Stonecutter is moved, it'll break any block that's above it with silk touch effect.
quark_ponders.ponder.quark_magnet.text_1: Very hard blocks such as Obsidian can't be broken like this.
